intro: Pollalesta niceforoi, commonly known as the Malagasy moonflower, is a rare climbing plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has velvety, heart-shaped leaves and produces capsules as its fruit, which contain numerous small seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
